questions.question_text:
An engineer must design an automation solution for the Cisco ACI Fabric to speed up the deployment of logical network elements for tenant provisioning. When creating a solution, the engineer must keep in mind that the tool must support these requirements:
* Allow the rapid creation and removal of logical containers.
* Support the creation of custom modules and data structures.
* Be extensible with external libraries and modules.
* Allow rapid testing of code using an on-demand execution environment.
Which automation tool meets these requirements?

discussion.content:
The correct answer is A.
A = 255 is the highest router priority 
B = It is the same (as we are doing nothing)
C = Is not the highest router ID
D = Ineligible to become the DR/BDR

Selected Answer: A
Key points about OSPF priority 0:

 No DR election participation:
 When a router has a priority of 0, it will not be considered during the DR election process. 

Default priority is 1:
The standard OSPF priority value for a router interface is usually set to 1. 

Higher priority means higher chance of becoming DR:
A router with a higher priority value is more likely to be elected as the DR. 
Impact on network design:

Selected Answer: A
A is correct!

A is correct. Priority in OSPF is mainly used to influence/determine a designated router/backup designated router for a network. By default, the priority is 1 on all routers. A router with a high priority will always win the DR/BDR election process. 

If there is a tie, a router with the highest router ID wins the election. The router with the second highest OSPF priority or router ID will become a BDR.

choices.D: SW2# configure terminal SW2 (config)# interface ethernet 1/1 SW2 (config-if)# ip ospf priority 0
choices.A: SW2# configure terminal SW2 (config)# interface ethernet 1/1 SW2 (config-if)# ip ospf priority 255
choices.C: SW2# configure terminal SW2 (config)# router ospf 1 SW2 (config-router)# router-id 10.10.10.22
choices.B: SW2# configure terminal SW2 (config)# interface ethernet 1/1 SW2 (config-if)# ip ospf priority 1

choices.C: Send <fvAEPg dn="uni/tn-Test/ap-Test/epg-Tenant" status="created"/> to APIC payload using HTTP POST to the Cisco APIC.

questions.question_text: An engineer must create an EPG called "Test". The configuration request should succeed if the Tenant called "Tenant" and the application profile called "Test" exist. The firewall policy allows only the HTTP connectivity to APIC from the user's computer. Which action accomplishes this goal?
